mil3.7.4:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, how far away is it from here to the Brahma world?”
mil3.7.4:1.3: “So far, your majesty, that if a rock the size of a peaked-roof building had fallen from there, and falling at the speed of eighty-four thousand yojanas per day, it would take four months to land on the earth.”
mil3.7.4:2.1: “Venerable sir, you say thus, ‘Just as a strong man might stretch out his bent arm or bend his stretched arm, in the same way a bhikkhu with psychic powers who has attained mastery over his mind could disappear from Jambudīpa and appear in the Brahma world.’ This I do not believe that one might go so quickly over so many hundreds of yojanas.”
